policy.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization
policy.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The company has adopted a strict no-smoking policy.
It is hospital policy to screen all mothers with certain risk factors.
it is (somebody’s) policy to do something
policy.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a contract with an insurance company, or an official written statement giving all the details of such a contract
policy.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: There’s a clause in the policy that I’d like to discuss.
I’ve just renewed the policy (=arranged for it to continue).
Does the policy cover theft and fire?
You can take out a policy (=buy one) for as little as $11.00 a month.
policy.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a particular principle that you believe in and that influences the way you behave
policy.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: It’s always been my policy not to gossip.
it is somebody’s policy to do something

policy.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a course of action that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, business, or other organization
policy.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: It’s company policy not to give interviews to the press.
